org.smslib
Class CService

java.lang.Object
  org.smslib.CService

public class CService
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main SMSLib service class.

Constructor Detail

CService

public CService(java.lang.String port,
                int baud,
                java.lang.String gsmDeviceManufacturer,
                java.lang.String gsmDeviceModel)
CService constructor.

Parameters:
port - The comm port to use (i.e. COM1, /dev/ttyS1 etc).
baud - The baud rate. 57600 is a good number to start with.
gsmDeviceManufacturer - The manufacturer of the modem (i.e. Wavecom, Nokia, Siemens, etc).
gsmDeviceModel - The model (i.e. M1306B, 6310i, etc).
Method Detail

getConnected

public boolean getConnected()
Return the status of the connection.

Warning: The method return the "theoretical" status of the connection, without testing the actual connection at the time of the call.

Returns:
True if the GSM device is connected.
See Also:
connect(), disconnect()

setSmscNumber

public void setSmscNumber(java.lang.String smscNumber)
Sets the SMSC number. Needed in rare cases - normally, you should not set the SMSC number yourself and let the GSM device get it from its SIM.

Parameters:
smscNumber - The SMSC number (international format).

setMessageHandler

public void setMessageHandler(ISmsMessageListener messageHandler)
Sets the message handler for ASYNC mode. The handler is called automatically from SMSLib when a message is received. This handler is valid only for Asynchronous operation mode - in other modes, it is not used.

Parameters:
messageHandler - The message handler routine - must comply with ISmsMessageListener interface.
See Also:
getMessageHandler()

public ISmsMessageListener getMessageHandler()
Returns the message handler (if any).

Returns:
The message handler.
See Also:
setMessageHandler(ISmsMessageListener)

setCallHandler

public void setCallHandler(ICallListener callHandler)
Sets the call handler. Works in ALL modes. The handler is called automatically once SMSLib receives an incoming call.

Parameters:
callHandler - The call handler routine - must comply with ICallListener interface.

Parameters:
secs - The interval in seconds.

setKeepAliveInterval

public void setKeepAliveInterval(int secs)
Sets the Keep-Alive Interval - every how many seconds the Keep-Alive thread will run and send a dummy OK command to the GSM modem. This is used to keep the serial port alive and prevent it from timing out. The interval is, by default, set to 30 seconds which should be enough for all modems.

Parameters:
secs - The Keep-Alive Interval in seconds.
See Also:
getKeepAliveInterval()

getKeepAliveInterval

public int getKeepAliveInterval()
Returns the Keep-Alive Interval, in seconds.

Returns:
The Keep-Alive Interval in seconds.
See Also:
setKeepAliveInterval(int)

setRetriesNoResponse

public void setRetriesNoResponse(int retries)
Sets the number of retries that SMSLib performs during dispatch of a message, if it fails to get a response from the modem within the timeout period.

After the number of retries complete and the message is not sent, SMSLib treats it as undeliverable.

The default values should be ok in most cases.

Parameters:
retries - The number of retries.
See Also:
getRetriesNoResponse(), setDelayNoResponse(int), getDelayNoResponse()

getRetriesNoResponse

public int getRetriesNoResponse()
Returns the current number of retries.

Returns:
The number of retries.
See Also:
setRetriesNoResponse(int)

Parameters:
delay - The delay in millisecs.

setProtocol

public void setProtocol(int protocol)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the protocol to be used.

The default protocol is PDU. If you want to change it, you must call this method after constructing the CService object and before connecting. Otherwise, you will get an exception.

Parameters:
protocol - The protocol to be used.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
getProtocol(), CService.Protocol

getProtocol

public int getProtocol()
Returns the protocol in use.

Returns:
The protocol use.
See Also:
CService.Protocol

setStorageLocations

public void setStorageLocations(java.lang.String loc)
Sets the storage locations to be read by SMSLib.

Normally, SMSLib tries to read the available storage locations reported by the modem itself. Sometimes, the modem does not report all storage locations, so you can use this method to define yours, without messing with main SMSLib code.

Parameters:
loc - The storage locations (i.e. a string similar to "SMME", which is specific to each modem)

connect

public void connect()
             throws java.lang.Exception
Connects to the GSM modem.

The connect() function should be called before any operations. Its purpose is to open the serial link, check for modem existence, initialize modem, start background threads and prepare for subsequent operations.

Throws:
NotConnectedException - Nobody is answering.
AlreadyConnectedException - Already connected.
NoPinException - If PIN is requested from the modem but no PIN is defined.
InvalidPinException - If the defined PIN is not accepted by the modem.
NoPduSupportException - The modem does not support PDU mode - fatal error!
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
disconnect()

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws java.lang.Exception
Disconnects from the GSM modem.

This should be the last function called. Closes serial connection, shuts down background threads and performs clean-up.

Notes

  • Do not connect and disconnect continously - at least if you can avoid it. It takes time and resources. Connect once and stay connected.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
connect()

readMessages

public void readMessages(java.util.LinkedList messageList,
                         int messageClass)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Reads all SMS messages from the GSM modem.

Parameters:
messageList - The list to be populated with messages.
messageClass - The message class of the messages to read.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
readMessages(LinkedList, int, int), CIncomingMessage, CIncomingMessage.MessageClass, sendMessage(COutgoingMessage)

readMessages

public void readMessages(java.util.LinkedList messageList,
                         int messageClass,
                         int limit)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Reads up to a specific number of SMS messages from the GSM modem.

Parameters:
messageList - The list to be populated with messages.
messageClass - The message class of the messages to read.
limit - Read up to number of messages. If limit is set to 0, read all messages.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
readMessages(LinkedList, int), CIncomingMessage, CIncomingMessage.MessageClass, sendMessage(COutgoingMessage)

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(COutgoingMessage message)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Sends an SMS message from the GSM modem.

This method actually wraps the message in a list and calls #sendMessage(List) that does the job.

Parameters:
message - The message to be sent.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
sendMessage(LinkedList), readMessages(LinkedList, int)

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.util.LinkedList messageList)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Sends a list of messages from the GSM modem.

The function iterates through the supplied list of COutgoingMessage objects and tries to send them.

Upon succesful sending, each COutgoingMessage object should have its RefNo and DispatchDate fields set to specific values. Upon failure, the RefNo will be set to 0 and DispatchDate set to null.

Parameters:
messageList - A list of COutgoingMessage objects presenting messages that will be sent out.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
sendMessage(COutgoingMessage), COutgoingMessage, CWapSIMessage, readMessages(LinkedList, int)

deleteMessage

public void deleteMessage(CIncomingMessage message)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Deletes a message from the modem's memory.

Warning: Do not pass invalid CIncomingMessage objects to this call - You may corrupt your modem's storage!

Delete operations are irreversible.

Parameters:
message - The CIncomingMessage object previously read with readMessages() call.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
CIncomingMessage, readMessages(LinkedList, int)

deleteMessages

public void deleteMessages(int messageClass)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Deletes ALL messages of the specified message class.

Delete operations are irreversible.

Parameters:
messageClass - The message class.
Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
CIncomingMessage.MessageClass

refreshDeviceInfo

public void refreshDeviceInfo()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Reads (or refreshes) all GSM modem information (like manufacturer, signal level, etc).

This method is called automatically upon connection. Should you require fresh info, you should call it yourself when you need it.

Throws:
NotConnectedException - Either connect() is not called or modem has been disconnected.
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
CDeviceInfo
